item.title: Meghan add a quote by Helene Hanff
item.description: "I do love secondhand books that open to the page some previous owner read oftenest. The day Hazlitt came he opened to "I hate to read new books," and I hollered "Comrade!" to whoever owned it before me." -- Helene Hanff

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "By the side of the everlasting Why there is a Yes--a transitory Yes if you like, but a Yes." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Meghan add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "She could not explain in so many words, but she felt that those who prepare for all the emergencies of life beforehand may equip themselves at the expense of joy." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "There is no surer foundation for a beautiful friendship than a mutual taste in literature." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "Freddie experienced the sort of abysmal soul-sadness which afflicts one of Tolstoy's Russian peasants when, after putting in a heavy day's work strangling his father, beating his wife, and dropping the baby into the city's reservoir, he turns to the cupboards, only to find the vodka bottle empty." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "If flying-saucer creatures or angels or whatever were to come here in a hundred years, say, and find us gone like the dinosaurs, what might be a good message for humanity to leave for them, maybe carved in great big letters on a Grand Canyon wall? Here is this old poop's suggestion: WE PROBABLY COULD HAVE SAVED OURSELVES, BUT WERE TOO DAMNED LAZY TO TRY VERY HARD..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Meghan add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp, drizzly November in my soul; whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses, and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me, that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street, and methodically knocking people's hats off - then, I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "It is impossible to enjoy idling thoroughly unless one has plenty of work to do. There is no fun in doing nothing when you have nothing to do. Wasting time is merely an occupation then, and a most exhausting one. Idleness, like kisses, to be sweet must be stolen." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Andrew Carnegie
item.description: "There is not such a cradle of democracy upon the earth as the Free Public Library, this republic of letters, where neither rank, office, nor wealth receives the slightest consideration." -- Andrew Carnegie

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We have our Arts so we won't die of Truth" -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Meghan add a quote by Joanna Russ
item.description: "At the level of high culture with which this book is concerned, active bigotry is probably fairly rare. <i>It is also hardly ever necessary</i>, since the social context is so far from neutral. To act in a way both sexist and racist, to maintain one's class privilege, it is only necessary to act in the customary, ordinary, usual, even polite manner." -- Joanna Russ
